content.body: Hey, I was looking through some of the notes from the last plenary, and I noticed that for "Don't call well-known Symbol methods for RegExp on primitive values", it was pointed out that core-js implements the proposed PR rather than the spec
and that doesn't seem to be true: https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/master/packages/core-js/modules/es.string.match.js#L20
I assume that claim was based on https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/3009#issuecomment-1451639187
